body_content.explanation: an idea or opinion of what something or someone is like:
examples: I didn't get much of an impression of the place because it was dark when we drove through it.
What was your impression of Charlotte's husband?
I don't tend to trust first impressions (= the opinion you form when you meet someone or see something for the first time).
When I first met him I got/had the impression that he was a shy sort of person.

body_content.explanation: to think that something is true, especially when it is not:
examples: I was under the impression (that) you didn't get on too well.

body_content.explanation: the way that something seems, looks, or feels to a particular person:
examples: It makes/gives/creates a very bad impression if you're late for an interview.
He likes to give the impression (that) he's terribly popular and has lots of friends.

body_content.explanation: an attempt at copying another person's manner and speech, etc., especially in order to make people laugh:
examples: She does a really good impression of the president.

body_content.explanation: a mark made on the surface of something by pressing an object onto it:
examples: There were impressions around her ankles made by the tops of her socks.

body_content.explanation: all the copies of a book that have been printed at the same time without any changes being made:
examples: This is the second impression of the encyclopedia.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when someone visits or sees a particular page on the internet:
examples: The company pointed to a 15 per cent rise in page impressions on its website.
